commText: de Kock and Rahul are at the crease. de Kock is on strike. Khaleel Ahmed will open the attack
Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, FOUR, on the shorter side, de Kock throws his hands at it, slashes hard as the outside edge flies gully, off the mark with a boundary
Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, no run, yorker length delivery outside off, de Kock tries to squeeze it out, gets beaten on the outside edge

Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, no run, appeal for an lbw, turned down! This was pitched up by Khaleel Ahmed and the batter got beaten and rapped on the pads. A huge inside edge, hence the fielders weren't that excited
Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, 2 runs, pitched up by the bowler on off, de Kock pushes it into the pocket at cover for a couple of runs
Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, no run, fired on leg, de Kock tries to flick it away, gets hit on the pads though. Sliding down the leg-side mostly

Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, FOUR, lucky escape for de Kock. This was another full length delivery and de Kock got an inside edge as he went for a drive. Misses the stumps marginally and races away to the fine leg fence. A productive over, but Khaleel troubled the opener on quite a few occasions
Ishant Sharma, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Ishant to Rahul, 1 run, short of a length around off, Rahul opens the bat face, steering this to third man for a single
Ishant to de Kock, no run, 134.9kph, short and quick on off, de Kock has a swing and a miss. Plays too many high risk shots
Ishant to de Kock, no run, short and wide outside off, de Kock cuts it to the fielder at point
Ishant to de Kock, 1 run, on the shorter side, de Kock drags it towards mid-wicket with a half-hearted pull and scampers across to the other end
Ishant to Rahul, 1 run, pitched up by the bowler on off, Rahul drives it to mid-off and takes a single

Ishant to de Kock, FOUR, much better from QdK. Was in total control of this shot. Ishant pitched it up on off and de Kock lofted it over the infield at cover. Excellent timing as the ball landed just before the cushions, one bounce and over the fence

Khaleel Ahmed to Rahul, SIX, first maximum! Khaleel Ahmed goes full on off and Rahul has timed it to perfection. Lofts it over deep extra cover for a flat six. Couldn't have hit that any better, class written all over it
Khaleel Ahmed to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length around off, Rahul taps it into the off-side and scampers across to the bowler's end
Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, FOUR, runs coming thick and fast. Khaleel Ahmed pitches it up and de Kock has thumped it over cover for a rollicking boundary. He's off to a brisk start
Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, no run, drilled straight back. A half volley by the pacer and de Kock smacks the stumps at the bowler's end with this cracking straight drive
Quinton de Kock has been adjudged lbw and he reviews it!
Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, THATS OUT!! Lbw!!

Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, out Lbw!! Khaleel draws first blood! de Kock departs after playing a handy cameo. Khaleel Ahmed goes full and quick on leg, de Kock like most of the times swings across the line, and has to pay the price for it. Clipping the leg-stump, confirm the replays and the southpaw has to take the long way back to the pavilion.. de Kock lbw b Khaleel Ahmed 19(13) [4s-4]''
Devdutt Padikkal, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Khaleel Ahmed to Padikkal, no run, low full toss on off, Padikkal drives it crisply to mid-off
Ishant to Rahul, 1 run, short of a length on off, Rahul cuts it through point for a single
Ishant to Padikkal, wide, fires this down the leg-side, Padikkal fails to connect his glance
Quinton de Kock vs LA Fast in IPL 2024 Runs: 58 Balls: 51 Dismissals: 4 Avg: 14.5 SR: 113.72 4s/6s: 9/1 Dots: 29
Ishant to Padikkal, no run, fraction short around middle and off, Padikkal rides the bounce and defends it into the off-side
Ishant to Padikkal, 2 runs, tad short on middle and leg, worked through the on-side with soft hands for a brace

Ishant to Padikkal, wide, another loose delivery by Ishant, it's a wide down the leg-side. Pant had reviewed for a wide, but he is now walking up to the umpire and having an argument with him. The DC captain reckons he didn't want to review it, but replays confirm he had done so. Think Pant was checking with one of the fielders
Ishant to Padikkal, 1 run, short of a length around off, Padikkal steers it into the off-side for a single
Ishant to Rahul, FOUR, width on offer and Rahul has smashed it. Gets hold of it and slaps the short and wide ball through cover with disdain. No need to run for those
Ishant to Rahul, 2 runs, steers the back of a length delivery through backward point for a couple of runs does Rahul
Khaleel Ahmed to Padikkal, wide, well directed bouncer, Padikkal sways away. Wide given as this was over Padikkal's head
Khaleel Ahmed to Padikkal, no run, back of a length around middle and leg, Padikkal looks to nudge it away, gets an inside edge on to the pads
Khaleel Ahmed to Padikkal, THATS OUT!! Lbw!!

Khaleel Ahmed to Padikkal, out Lbw!! Another failure for Padikkal! On a length around middle and leg, the ball skids along the deck as Padikkal gets beaten and rapped on the pads. Khaleel goes up in an appeal and up goes the umpire's finger. KL Rahul reckons this would have crashed into the stumps, hence they don't review it either. Replays confirm three reds. Good call not to go for the review. Padikkal lbw b Khaleel Ahmed 3(6)
Marcus Stoinis, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Khaleel Ahmed to Stoinis, 1 run, dropped! Khaleel Ahmed goes full and Stoinis chips it right back at the pacer. He does well to get his hands to it, but it hit him on the forearm I guess. Hardly had any time to react, was a tough chance. Allows Stoinis to open his account
Khaleel Ahmed to Rahul, FOUR, creamed down the ground! Khaleel Ahmed goes full on middle and Rahul nails his straight drive, a glorious boundary for the LSG captain
Khaleel Ahmed to Rahul, 1 run, on the pads, Rahul clips it to mid-on for a single
Padikkal vs LA Fast in IPL 2024 Runs: 5 Balls: 14 Dismissals: 3 Avg: 1.67 SR: 35.71 Dots: 11
Khaleel Ahmed to Stoinis, no run, short of a length outside off, Stoinis goes for a feeble push, gets an outside edge on a couple of bounces to slip

1-5 Over Summary: >> De Kock gets two boundaries behind square against Khaleel >> Khaleel gets de Kock LBW next over, umpire’s call on review >> Padikkal’s bad streak continues, out LBW to Khaleel >> DC are 47/2 after five overs
Mukesh Kumar, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
Mukesh Kumar to Rahul, FOUR, 50 up for LSG! Mukesh Kumar goes short on leg and Rahul has glanced this away to the fine leg fence with nonchalance
Khaleel has gone off the field along with the physio, hope it's nothing serious
Mukesh Kumar to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul dealing in boundaries. Timing the ball so well. Advances down the wicket and times his drive through cover, back-to-back boundaries against Mukesh Kumar
Pant moves up to the stumps..
Mukesh Kumar to Rahul, no run, short of a length around middle and leg, Rahul hops a tad and guides it back to Mukesh
Mukesh Kumar to Rahul, no run, on a length around off, pushed to cover with soft hands by Rahul
Mukesh Kumar to Rahul, 1 run, squeezed in front of backward point for one
Mid-wicket moves to deep mid-wicket
Mukesh Kumar to Stoinis, 1 run, short and quick on middle and leg, tucked to square leg for a single
Axar Patel, Left arm orthodox, comes into the attack
Axar to Stoinis, no run, floated on off, driven to cover by Stoinis
Axar to Stoinis, no run, full and straight on off, Stoinis drives it back to Axar

LSG No.3 batters since IPL 2023 Inns: 20 Runs: 261 Avg: 13.73 SR: 106.96 50s: 1 (64* by Prerak Mankad vs SRH in 2023) In 20 batting innings across IPL 2023 and 2024 including today, LSG have used six different batters at No.3 - Deepak Hooda, Devdutt Padikkal, Prerak Mankad, Ayush Badoni, Krunal Pandya and Karan Sharma - with them registering 13 single-digit scores among them.
Axar to Stoinis, 1 run, driven along the carpet to long-on for a single
Axar to Rahul, 1 run, Axar goes full on middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
Axar to Stoinis, FOUR, first boundary for Stoinis! He advances down the track and thumps it over the bowler's head. Couldn't have placed it any straighter
Axar to Stoinis, leg byes, 1 run, quicker through the air on leg, keeps low as it skids along the deck. Stoinis gets hit on the pads as they take a leg bye. Was clealy sliding down leg
Kuldeep Yadav, comes into the attack
Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, 1 run, full and wide outside off, Stoinis drives it to wide long-off for one
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahul, 1 run, quicker through the air, Rahul works it through mid-wicket for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, out Caught by Ishant!! Kuldeep strikes in his first over! A nicely tossed up delivery on off, Stoinis throws his hands at it, gets a leading edge that flies straight to backward point. Easy catch for Ishant and Stoinis' rusty knock comes to an end. Wickets in the middle overs, this is what DC have been missing over the last few games. Stoinis c Ishant b Kuldeep Yadav 8(10) [4s-1]
Nicholas Pooran, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, out Bowled!! Kuldeep Yadav is on a hat-trick! Pooran walks back without troubling the scorers, he's gone for a golden duck! A straighter delivery on off, breaches Pooran's defence and the off pole goes for a toss. Looks like LSG are calling for an impact sub. Pooran b Kuldeep Yadav 0(1)
LSG have an impact sub in the form of Deepak Hooda - de Kock goes out.. The off-stump needs to be replaced as it seems to be broken..

Strategic timeout! As the stump gets replaced, they have taken a timeout. DC on top as Kuldeep's introductiion has given them two wickets in an over. Rahul is going along strong from one end, but they are losing wickets from the other end. Will the impact sub manage to make an impact? Let's find out..
Deepak Hooda, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Kuldeep Yadav to Hooda, 1 run, Hooda denies Kuldeep a hat-trick, drives this to wide long-off for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahul, no run, appeal for an lbw turned down. A tossed up delivery on leg, Rahul goes for a sweep, gets beaten. Kuldeep was excited, but Pant asks him to calm down
Nicholas Pooran vs Kuldeep Yadav in T20s Runs: 52 Balls: 57 Dismissals: 5 Avg: 10.4 SR: 91.22 Dots: 28
Axar to Hooda, 1 run, flatter delivery on off, driven along the carpet to long-off for one
Axar to Rahul, FOUR, short and punished! Rocks back in the crease and cuts this through backward point for four runs. Skipper leading from the front

STAT: Before today, the last instance of KL Rahul striking at above 170 within the first six overs in an IPL innings came in 2021: 38* off 18 en route 98* off 42 in PBKS’s last league game against CSK in Dubai.
Axar to Rahul, 2 runs, darted on middle and leg, nudged to wide long-on for a couple of runs by Rahul
Axar to Rahul, no run, fraction short on off, Rahul rocks back and cuts it to the fielder at point
Axar to Rahul, 1 run, straighter delivery on off, Rahul pushes it to mid-off and takes a single
Axar to Hooda, 1 run, flatter through the air, Hooda knocks it into the pocket at cover for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Hooda, no run, floated on off, driven to cover by Hooda
Kuldeep Yadav to Hooda, 1 run, down on his knee as he sweeps the floated delivery to deep mid-wicket for a single
Review taken for a caught behind! Pant and Kuldeep look confident..
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahul, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahul, out Caught by Pant!! Within a matter of two overs, Kuldeep Yadav has turned this match on its head. Straighter delivery outside off, it keeps a tad low, Rahul goes for a late cut and the ball flicks the bottom part of his bat. Pant knew he had edged it, takes the review and that's that from the LSG captain. Three wickets for the left arm spinner. DC on top! Rahul c Pant b Kuldeep Yadav 39(22) [4s-5 6s-1]
Ayush Badoni, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Kuldeep Yadav to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, flatter delivery on off, Ayush Badoni knocks it into the off-side for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Hooda, 2 runs, swept down to fine leg by Hooda for a couple of runs
Kuldeep Yadav to Hooda, no run, nicely tossed up delivery on off, Hooda pushes it in front of cover

6-10 Over Summary: >> Rahul welcomes Mukesh Kumar with back-to-back boundaries >> Returning Kuldeep strikes off successive balls in first over >> Pooran out for a first ball duck >> LSG use the Impact Sub early, Hooda replaces de Kock >> Rahul gone caught behind, given out on review >> Lucknow in a spot of bother at 80/5 after 10 overs
Axar to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, darted on middle and leg, nudged into the leg-side by Ayush Badoni for a single
Axar to Hooda, no run, pushed to cover by Hooda as Axar goes straight on off
Axar to Hooda, 1 run, full and straight on middle and leg, driven along the carpet to long-on for a single
Axar to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, played with soft hands, nudged towards backward square leg for one
Axar to Hooda, 1 run, knocked to long-on by Hooda for a single
Axar to Ayush Badoni, no run, down the track to flick this away, doesn't middle it though, off the pads as the ball drops next to the pitch
Ishant Sharma [2.0-0-19-0] is back into the attack
Ishant to Hooda, 1 run, short of a length on off, steered to point by Hooda for a single
Ishant to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, opens the bat face, steering this to third man for a single
Ishant to Hooda, 1 run, short of a length on middle, Hooda whips it to long-on along the carpet
Ishant to Ayush Badoni, wide, Ishant goes short and wide outside off, Ayush Badoni lets it through to the keeper
Ishant to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, short of a length on middle and leg, nudged to long-on for a single
Ishant to Hooda, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Ishant to Hooda, out Caught by Warner!! LSG sink further. Banged in short by Ishant, Hooda looks to take him on. Swings across the line as the top edge balloons high up in the sky. Warner at point moves to his right, settles under the skier and completes a safe catch. Nothing going right from Lucknow since the last 30 minutes. Will need a special effort from Krunal and Badoni. Hooda c Warner b Ishant 10(13)
Krunal Pandya, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Ishant to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, short ball on leg, Krunal Pandya helps it to fine leg for a single
Mukesh Kumar [1.0-0-10-0] is back into the attack
Mukesh Kumar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, cramped for room with this short ball, tucked into the leg-side by Krunal Pandya for a single
Review taken for a caught behind by Mukesh! Has Badoni edged this?

Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, no run, they have lost a review! Nothing on UltraEdge. Was a bouncer by Mukesh Kumar and Ayush Badoni got beaten as he attempted a pull. No bat involved and Badoni survives. Pant said he didn't hear anything but the fielders forced him to challenge the onfield call
Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, slower delivery outside off, Ayush Badoni steers it to third man for a single
Mukesh Kumar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, on a length outside off, Krunal Pandya guides it to third man for a single
Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, banged in short by Mukesh Kumar, Ayush Badoni pulls it through mid-wicket for one
Mukesh Kumar to Krunal Pandya, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Mukesh Kumar to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Pant!! Another one bites the dust! Short and quick on off, Krunal Pandya hops in the crease and looks to cut it, but gets cramped for room. Too close to the body and it flicks the batter's gloves on its way to the keeper. LSG losing their way after a decent start. Krunal Pandya c Pant b Mukesh Kumar 3(4)

Strategic timeout! LSG in desperate need of a partnership as they have lost 7 wickets with 7 overs remaining. Hooda - the impact sub couldn't steady the innings and departed early and DC bowlers are making sure to keep the pressure on with regular wickets..
Arshad Khan, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Kuldeep Yadav [2.0-0-7-3] is back into the attack
Kuldeep Yadav to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, flatter and shorter outside off, Badoni cracks it to sweeper cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, no run, tossed up but the length is short, Arshad punches it back to Kuldeep
There's a slip in place
Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, no run, flighted and draws Arshad forward, blocked back with a straight bat
Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, 2 runs, shortens the length and Arshad punches it straight to cover, Stubbs fumbles and concedes a brace
Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, 2 runs, googly and Arshad heaves it with the spin wide of long-on, easy brace
Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, 1 run, short of length around off, Arshad knocks it to cover-point
Mukesh Kumar to Arshad Khan, 1 run, fullish delivery around off, Arshad inside halves the block backward of square
Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, FOUR, short and at the body, Badoni is cramped for room but still goes through with the pull, the ball hits the shoulder of the bat and flies wide of Pant
Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, FOUR, just over backward point. Pounded short and extracts the extra bounce, Badoni hops and cuts it uppishly, manages to evade a leaping Warner in that region
Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, full pitcher outside off, Badoni drives to sweeper cover
Mukesh Kumar to Arshad Khan, 1 run, I0$ back of a length around off, Arshad pushes off the outer half to third man
Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, wide, sprays it way outside off, Badoni ignores and collects the wide

Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, slower ball outside off, Badoni cuts square and Warner dives across from backward point, gets a hand and parries it away, Shaw swoops in from sweeper but can't prevent the second

11-15 Over Summary: >> Things slow down after that middle-order collapse >> Hooda tries to slog Ishant, ends up miscuing it to the fielder >> Krunal is bounced out by Mukesh Kumar >> Just 32 runs in this phase of play
Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, wide, fired down leg, Arshad misses the glance and it is called a wide
Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, 1 run, googly on leg-stump, Arshad nurdles it backward of square leg

Kuldeep Yadav to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, short of length around the hips, Badoni tucks with soft hands to square leg and races back for the second. He was off as soon as he played that and stole it with ease
Kuldeep Yadav to Ayush Badoni, no run, drifting away outside off, Badoni angles it with an open face to point
Kuldeep Yadav to Ayush Badoni, no run, this one skids off the deck, Badoni looks to cut and is beaten on the outside edge

Kuldeep Yadav to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, nudged gently to the vacant mid-wicket region and Arshad sprints back, puts in the dive and makes his ground. This is smart batting from Badoni, he's not taking chances against Kuldeep

Kuldeep Yadav to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, googly but short of length, Badoni knocks it in front of long-on. Kuldeep returns with impressive figures - 4-0-20-3. He's walked off the field and straight to the dressing room. Hope he's fine
Axar Patel [3.0-0-19-0] is back into the attack
Axar to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, comes down the track and pushes it to long-off
Axar to Arshad Khan, 1 run, short of length and drifted across, Arshad mistimes the flat-batted hit to long-off
Axar to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, just over Shaw. Badoni comes down the track and is met by a shortend length, he goes through with the chip and manages to get it over the cover region, two more
Axar to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, now tucks one square on the leg-side and rushes back for the second
Axar to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, played with soft hands to the off-side and Badoni rotates strike with ease
Axar to Arshad Khan, no run, sliding across the left hander, Arshad cuts and is beaten on the outside edge
Khaleel Ahmed [3.0-0-28-2] is back into the attack

Khaleel Ahmed to Ayush Badoni, SIX, wow! That's some way to greet Khaleel back to the attack. Short of length delivery and Badoni is quick to pounce, he transfers his weight back and nails the pull comfortably over deep square leg
Khaleel Ahmed to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, slower ball bowled into the wicket, Badoni pulls along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Khaleel Ahmed to Arshad Khan, FOUR, Arshad joins the act. Width on offer and it is stand and deliver stuff. Arshad stays on the back foot and dismisses the flat-batted hit between cover and mid-off
Khaleel Ahmed to Arshad Khan, no run, short of length outside off, Arshad attempts the ramp and is beaten on the top-edge

Khaleel Ahmed to Arshad Khan, leg byes, 2 runs, Khaleel was celebrappealing. But the umpire was not interested. Nails the yorker around leg-stump, Arshad is beaten and struck on the back pad. Pant informs Khaleel there are no reviews left. Anyway it wouldn't have mattered as replays show the ball to be missing leg-stump

Khaleel Ahmed to Arshad Khan, 2 runs, dropped! Shaw has put down a regulation high catch. Arshad swings across the line and does not get it anywhere close to the middle, the ball goes straight up and Shaw circles around mid-wicket, he never looked comfortable and just allowed the ball to go through his hands
Delhi Capitals are using their impact sub - Khaleel off and Abishek Porel in.
Mukesh Kumar [3.0-0-28-1] is back into the attack

Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, FOUR, the 50-run stand comes up. This is good batting and poor planning. Mukesh pitches it up with mid-off inside the ring. Badoni just had to clear the infield and he does so with ease, one bounce and over the ropes

Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, FOUR, wow! Badoni has just swept Mukesh Kumar. Mid-off was sent back and square leg brought in, so Badoni shuffles across and sends down, nails the sweep over the square leg region
Mukesh goes round the wicket
Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, very full and close to yorker length, Badoni digs it in front of long-on and races back for the second
Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, no run, shuffles across to play the lap and Mukesh follows him, Badoni toe-ends it back to Mukesh

Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, needless from Pant. Badoni moves across and is surprised by the short of length delivery, attempts the lap and ekes out an inside edge onto the thigh pad, the ball rolls behind and Arshad races to the other end, Pant has a shy at the stumps and concedes the extra run, keeping Badoni on strike. Arshad would have made it even if Pant had hit the target
Badoni seems to have hurt his finger. He called for the phsyio and is being attended to. Ready again and we continue..

Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, fifty for Badoni. Top knock under pressure. He came in with his team in deep trouble and is now taking them to safer shores. Raises his bat and soaks in the applause. Full toss around off, Badoni knocks it into the vacant mid-wicket region and retains strike
Ishant to bowl the final over..
Ishant Sharma [3.0-0-25-1] is back into the attack
Ishant to Ayush Badoni, FOUR, LSG have touched 160. Full pitcher outside off, Badoni walks across and thumps it over extra cover
Ishant to Ayush Badoni, no run, slower ball outside off, Badoni mistimes the flat-batted hit to long-on and denies the single. He wants to face all the balls
Ishant to Ayush Badoni, wide, yorker outside off, Badoni moves across and lets it pass. Should that have been a fair delivery? Badoni had shuffled
Ishant to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, off-pace short of length delivery, Badoni pulls to deep mid-wicket and wants a second, but it is not there

Ishant to Arshad Khan, FOUR, Arshad telling Badoni he can also do it. Ishant tries the wide yorker but Arshad reaches for it, opens the bat face and slices thre loft in front of square on the off-side, one bounce and over the ropes

Ishant to Arshad Khan, 1 run, dropped! But Warner prevented the six. Juicy full toss and Arshad swipes it flat towards long-on, Warner leaps up and gets both hands, but he was falling over and does well to release the ball into the playing area, saved five runs

Ishant to Ayush Badoni, no run, slower ball banged into the wicket, Badoni reaches for it and toe-ends it back to Ishant. Arshad wanted a single but has to hurry back. Excellent delivery to end the innings

21:25 Local Time, 15:55 GMT: Lucknow Super Giants have never lost an IPL game when defending 160+ and Badoni has got them past that total. This is an incredible recovery and it was all due to the 73-run partnership between Badoni and Arshad. The home side looked down and out after Khaleel and Kuldeep combined to pick 5 of the first 7 wickets. Khaleel struck twice in the powerplay while Kuldeep picked three wickets - Stoinis, Pooran and Rahul - in his first two overs. At 94/7 there was every chance of LSG being bowled out inside 20 overs, but Badoni played some sensible cricket - saw off the threat from Kuldeep and then took on the pacers. This total by no means is a daunting one especially with better batting conditions but it is something at least that LSG can look to defend. Back soon with the chase..

Ayush Badoni: Enjoyed it. Wasn't able to score in the last 3 innings. Feel blessed. Very thankful to the franchise for showing their support. This match I wanted to take it deep and build partnerships, tried to score off the bad balls. Arshad (Khan) played a great supportive role, that helped us cross 160. Hopefully we'll defend the total and win this game.

Highest partnerships for 8th wicket or below in the IPL 88* - Rashid Khan & Alzarri Joseph (GT) vs MI, Mumbai WS, 2023 73* - Ayush Badoni & Arshad Khan (LSG) vs DC, Lucknow, 2024 69 - Brad Hodge & James Faulkner (RR) vs MI, Ahmedabad, 2014 68 - Heinrich Klaasen & Bhuvneshwar Kumar (SRH) vs GT, Ahmedabad, 2023 55* - Shikhar Dhawan & Mohit Rathee (PBKS) vs SRH, Hyderabad, 2023 73* between Badoni and Arshad is the highest 8th wicket partnership in IPL history.

Highest partnerships for 6th wicket or below for LSG 84 - Ayush Badoni & Nicholas Pooran vs RCB, Bengaluru, 2023 74 - Ayush Badoni & Nicholas Pooran vs KKR, Kolkata, 2023 73* - Ayush Badoni & Arshad Khan vs DC, Lucknow, 2024 59 - Ayush Badoni & Nicholas Pooran vs CSK, Lucknow, 2023 47 - Ayush Badoni & KL Rahul vs MI, Mumbai WS, 2022 Badoni is involved in each of the top 8 highest partnerships for LSG for 6th wicket or below.
Pace vs Spin in LSG’s innings \nPace: 4/118 from 12 overs (ER: 9.83) \nSpin: 3/46 from 8 overs (ER: 5.75)
LSG innings progression Overs 1-7: 64/2 (RR: 9.14) Overs 8-14: 36/5 (RR: 5.14) Overs 15-20: 67/0 (RR: 11.17)
Ayush Badoni at No.7 in the IPL Inns: 7 Runs: 204 Avg: 51 SR: 152.23 50s: 2 HS: 59*

Welcome back.. The momentum is with Lucknow but things can change quickly. Delhi will need a good start and their openers - Warner and Shaw - are out in the middle. Arshad Khan given the new ball responsibility. He should have a spring in his step. One slip in place. We're ready to roll
